text: Lagarosiphon major is a monocotic aquatic plant native to Southern Africa. Common names include African elodea, curly waterweed, oxygen weed and South African oxygen weed. It is used as freshwater aquarium plant. It is an invasive plant in some countries.Global Invasive Species Database - Lagarosiphon major entry In New Zealand it is listed on the National Pest Plant Accord and is classed as a noxious weed in the United States. ==Distribution== Ireland: Co.Galway in parts of upper Lough Corrib.Pybus, C. and O'Halloran, P. 2009. Distribution of some submerged aquatic macrophytes in the Eglinton Canal. Ir. Nat. J. 30: 51-53. ==References== ==External links== * Global Invasive Species Database * Species Profile - Oxygen Weed (Lagarosiphon major). title: Lagarosiphon major
